greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is Euler transform of (j->j^k).
comment: In general, column k > 0 is asymptotic to (GAMMA(k+2)*Zeta(k+2))^((1-2*Zeta(-k)) /(2*k+4)) * exp((k+2)/(k+1) * (GAMMA(k+2)*Zeta(k+2))^(1/(k+2)) * n^((k+1)/(k+2)) + Zeta'(-k)) / (sqrt(2*Pi*(k+2)) * n^((k+3-2*Zeta(-k))/(2*k+4))). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 01 2015
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, A method of finding the asymptotics of q-series based on the convolution of generating functions, arXiv:1509.08708 [math.CO], Sep 30 2015, p. 21.
maple: with(numtheory): etr:= proc(p) local b; b:= proc(n) option remember; `if`(n=0,1, add(add(d*p(d), d=divisors(j)) *b(n-j), j=1..n)/n) end end: A:= (n,k)-> etr(j->j^k)(n); seq(seq(A(n,d-n), n=0..d), d=0..13);
mathematica: etr[p_] := Module[{ b}, b[n_] := b[n] = If[n == 0, 1, Sum[Sum[d*p[d], {d, Divisors[j]}]*b[n - j], {j, 1, n}]/n]; b]; A[n_, k_] := etr[Function[j, j^k]][n]; Table[Table[A[n, d - n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 13}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 27 2013, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 08 2008
